indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. The number of sites cleaned 2. Volumes of POP pesticides or conterminated soil treated . 3. Compliance with international standards for pesticide stockpiles management 4. Government budget allocations adequate to destroy stockpiles and to manage contaminated sites in future

baseline.comment: 1) According to MONRE data in 2010, there are more than 1000 contaminated sites in Vietnam that have potential adverse impact to people leaving around the sites. Foods produced from the high concentrated POP pesticide sites once taken by people will effect the health of those people. 2) 0 tones treated 3) There are no standards and guidance for management and destruction of POP pesticide in 2010, which local people and authority is not well aware of risks to their life and treatment methods. 4) The Government expenditure for this activities in 2006 is rather modest with an amount of USD 382,000

target.comment: 1) Clean at least 5 contaminated sites in Nghe An-Ha Tinh 2) (i) Collect 700 tones high Pop pesticides contaminated soil and treat at least 50% collected soil in Holcim company site; (ii) Properly isolate 5000 m3 of low POP contain soil 3) Improve knowledge and capacity of provincial staff on management and treatment of contaminated site by using standard Environmental Management Plan (EMP) guideline 4) No target for 2014 for this indicator

actual.comment: 1) 10 sites cleaned 2) (i) 1,626.3 tones high Pop pesticides contaminated soil collected and 566.5 tones collected soil fully treated at Holcim company; (ii) 5200 m3 of low POP contain soil isolated in Mau Hai, Thach Luu and Hon Tro 3) 99 provincial staff has improved knowledge and capacity on on management and treatment of contaminated site through 2 EMP training course using technical guideline in line with international standard 4) N/A, as no target was set for 2014

target.comment: 1) Clean at least 1 additional site 2) Further collect and treat additional 170 tones high Pop pesticides contaminated soil 3) (i) Capacity building/Continue training to ensure soil collection, treatment, management and monitoring in accordance with international standard (ii) Carry out non-combustion technology pilot and share information with provinces 4) More than US$ 10 million allocated from Govt budget

actual.comment: 1) Two more contaminated sites cleaned in Nghe An Province 2) Further collected 281 tone and treated additional 340.5 tones POP pesticides stockpile and contaminated soil 3) (i) 279 people trained in 7 courses in 2015; (ii) Three non-combustion technology tested 4) Approximately US$ 14 millions co-financing of Govt in 5 years project implementation

result.title: Objective
result.description: To remove capacity barriers to the sustainable elimination of POPs pesticides in Vietnam

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of sites posing threat to human health

baseline.comment: At least 600 sites with known or potential adverse human health impacts and risk for the environment

target.comment: By the end of the project at least 1140 tons of POPs waste is destructed and the sites where the pesticides are removed for disposal are rehabilitated, acute risks to human health and the environment are eliminated and potential and latent risk are respectively re-mediated on the mid term and contained for the long term. For these sites a aftercare and monitoring program is available. By the end of the project the project Team is trained and has experiences in managing such rehabilitation POPs pesticides project and more than one destruction company is able to destruct POPs pesticides in Vietnam.

actual.comment:
1. As of 30 June 2015, total POPs pesticides waste and stockpiles destroyed by the project was approximately 720 tons. Of which, around 488 tons were collected in Nghe An and Ha Tinh provinces and destroyed at Holcim during this reporting period.
2. In this reporting period, through the National Target Program for Pollution Mitigation and Environment improvement (NTP-PMEI) and 1946 Program, the Government budget was provided to carry out remediation activities at 20 sites with a total budget of approximately 194 billion VND (equivalent to approximately 8.7 million USD).
Local Governments also provided 420 million VND (equivalent to 19,000 USD) for excavating, packaging and local transportation of 67.9 tons of contaminated soil at the Tan Long, Tan Phu and Hung Khanh sites, which were treated at Holcim using funding from the GEF project budget.

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Improved capacity facilitates elimination of POPs pesticides stockpiles

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: International standards met in management of pesticide stockpiles.

baseline.comment: There is no standards and guideline for management and destruction of POPs pesticides.

target.comment: International standards will be adopted for management and treatment of POP pesticide stockpiles and POP pesticide contaminated sites.

actual.comment: The revision of the Technical Guidelines on Environmental Management of POPs Pesticide Contaminated Sites (formerly called EMP) was completed after user-testing and final consultation in 2014. One thousand five hundred (1,500) copies of the guideline were printed, distributed during training courses and to provincial Departments of Natural Resources and Environment (DONREs).

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Government allocates adequate budget to destroy stockpiles and manage contaminated sites

target.comment: From 2008 onwards, Government expenditure for destruction of POPs pesticides is at least $600,000 /year (until stockpiles destroyed)

actual.comment:
In this reporting period 2014-2015, Government budget was provided to carry out remediation activities at 20 sites with a total budget of approximately 194 billions VND (equivalent to approximately 8.7 million USD).
Nghe An and Ha Tinh provinces also provided 420 million VNDs (equivalent to 19,000 USD) for excavating, packaging and local transportation of 67.9 tons of contaminated soil at the Tan Long, Tan Phu and Hung Khanh sites, which were treated at Holcim using funding from the GEF project budget.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Existence of potential qualified and licensed National and International companies besides Holcim

baseline.comment: Not aware of more than one National qualified company. International qualified companies are known

target.comment: Eliminate the monopoly position of Holcim in the POP treatment market in Vietnam. National and local Government know better/more about treatment & technology suppliers, both internationally & nationally.

actual.comment: Field pilots for three (3) non-combustion technologies for soil decontamination are on-going using (1) Daramend technology; (2) Nano Iron soil treatment; and (3) Soil washing. The field pilots are expected to be completed by Sept-Oct 2015 and the results will be incorporated in the technology handbook that is being drafted on available and relevant technologies for soil remediation. That handbook would help provinces seeking appropriate technologies.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Expression of interest received from potential qualified and licensed National and International companies

baseline.comment: Potential qualified and licensed national and International companies are not aware of the upcoming site rehabilitation project including POPs pesticide destruction. Project Team is not aware if potential qualified and licensed National and International companies have interest in this site rehabilitation project including POPs pesticide destruction.

target.comment: Potential qualified and licensed National and International companies are well informed and participated in the bidding of treatment packages by the project and by Government budget.

actual.comment: Compared to the beginning of the project, national and local Governments have a better knowledge on available and suitable treatment technologies as well as existing technology suppliers in this market. Technology suppliers, both national and international, are better informed through e-mails and UNDP website of decontamination and disposal opportunities. This was confirmed by the large number of companies participating in the international bidding procedures, which took place during the previous reporting period. Therefore, Holcim no longer holds a monopoly position in this market in Viet Nam.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Data sheets/database of contaminated sites is set up. The database is user-friendly that easy for uploading data and extracting information

baseline.comment: Four different inventories are made using four different data formats. The data vary in level of details and quality. In total 1153 site have are recorded and most likely less than half of the site is visited for an inventory. Information on the site data sheet varies from only a site name to detailed assessments. These data are partly entered in two different data sets with a different set up

target.comment: Database of contaminated sites is available and ready for use

actual.comment: The contaminated sites database is publicly available at caithienmoitruong.vea.gov.vn:9000/. Final adjustments and corrections will be completed by June-July 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: PSMS (Pesticides Stockpiles Management System) installed at MARD.

target.comment: PSMS runs as database system

actual.comment: This FAO-supported component was completed during the previous reporting period.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: A data of priority sites, which need treatment, is made available to the relevant stakeholders and authorities. The data contains relevant and reliable information for identifying environmental and human health risks and for making site clean-up plans.

baseline.comment: Around 500 sites are being prioritized for treatment based on the Cir 07 and Article 92. Treatment priority of contaminated sites are catergorised based on level of concentration in the soil and not yet based on the risks/risk assessment report.

target.comment: Risk assessment is done for prioritized sites that selected and will be treated by project budget

actual.comment: Completed in the 2012-2013 reporting period. During this reporting period, local governments started applying the risk assessment method to contaminated sites in their respective provinces.

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: Clear technical guideline that can improve the quality of standard rehabilitation plan including budget and time planning for each POPs pesticide site category.

baseline.comment: Guidelines by MOSTE in 1999 for pesticides destruction are obsolete pesticides and not appropriate for POPs Pesticides. No guideline for properly making preliminary risk assessment and identifying potential and latent risks

target.comment: Appropriated technical guideline and SOP are available

actual.comment: 1500 copies of the Technical Guidelines (formerly EMP) were printed, distributed during trainings and sent by mail to provincial DONREs.

indicator.title: Indicator 11
indicator.description: Existence of piloted emptied container management programme

baseline.comment: There is no container management programme

target.comment: Feasibility study on emptied container management programme completed and delivered

actual.comment: This is an activity under FAO component, which was completed during the previous reporting period.

indicator.title: Indicator 13
indicator.description:
Bidding Documents containing clear technical specifications, site specific rehabilitation plan, and estimated bill of quantities for each site / group of sites with enough details in order to facilitate bidder understanding and joining the bid.
CSM per site including pictures, drawings, analytical data and a detailed risk assessment.

baseline.comment: There is no CSMs for the 6 priority sites that selected for treatment by project budget

target.comment: 6 selected priority sites are approved by all stakeholders. The site survey and CSM for the 6 selected priority sites are completed. TOR for treatment of 6 selected priority sites is approved.

actual.comment: Bidding activities were completed during the previous reporting period. No further activities to report on.
Bidding activities were completed during the previous reporting period. No further activities to report on.

indicator.title: Indicator 15
indicator.description: Filled in standard rehabilitation plan supplemented with site specific rehabilitation aspects, an estimated budget for each site. A contractor should be able to make a bid, and cost estimate

baseline.comment: No site rehabilitation plan exists

target.comment: 6 detail rehabilitation plans including an estimated budget are completed

actual.comment: Completed during the previous reporting period. No further activity to report on this year.

indicator.title: Indicator 16
indicator.description: Experienced trainer(s) with CV details are recruited to deliver training for government staff on POPs pesticides site cleanup

baseline.comment: Lack of knowledge on POPs pesticides site clean-up

target.comment: A competent trainer is contracted and delivered good training course to Government staff

actual.comment: This activity was completed during the previous reporting period. The training task has been included in the Visiting Technical Advisor's ToR. The Visiting Technical Advisor was recruited in 2013. Before that, training was part of Tauw contract.

indicator.title: Indicator 17
indicator.description: Number of Trainees that participated in trainings and obtained certificates

baseline.comment: Very limited number of government agencies have sufficient knowledge on contaminated site management, monitoring, disposal facilities, soil survey and soil insitu, onsite remediation

target.comment: Staff of government agencies are trained in appropriate technologies and application of standards and guidelines for site assessment including topsoil survey. Project Team and PM are also equipped to manage site cleanup campaigns.

actual.comment:
Five (5) training courses on the use and application of the Technical Guideline on Environmental Management of POPs Pesticides Contaminated Sites were conducted during this reporting period in Quang Binh (Sep 2014), Nghe An (Oct 2014), Nam Dinh (Mar 2015), Nghe An (Mar 2015) and Quang Ninh (Apr 2015).
One Sampling and Mapping Training was also conducted in Nam Dinh (June 2015).
The total number of staff trained during this reporting period was 265, of which 70% were from provinces.

indicator.title: Indicator 18
indicator.description: Contribution (study, comment paper ...) to the legal policy and framework through legal document revision and development.

baseline.comment: National legal policy and framework at the project design are not adequate for management and treatment of POPs pesticides contaminated sites

target.comment: Technical contributions is delivered to the Government, Institutionalised, applied and appreciated by MONRE

actual.comment:
-The project provided technical comments/inputs to the revision of Law on Environment Protection (LEP) which was approved in late June 2014. It was the first time LEP mentioned the need of applying a risk-based approach for assessing and managing contaminated sites, including POPs pesticides contaminated sites.
- The new technical standard (QCVN 54) on Treatment Threshold for Different Type of Land Use, developed with support of the project in 2013, appears to have important economic implications as in certain cases it can actually reduce the economic burden on national and local budget for the treatment of contaminated sites.
- For example, if the contaminated site is not planned for living or agricultural activities, it is unnecessary to treat contaminated soil to a POPs concentration level lower than 1.7 ppm. This can save money for national and local budget.

indicator.title: Indicator 19
indicator.description: Existence of Monitoring plan for contaminated sites in Vietnamese.

baseline.comment: There is no monitoringg plan for contaminated sites. No guideline or regulation state that it is neccessary.

target.comment: Participatory monitoring plan following international standards is developed and translated to Vietnamese

actual.comment: Aftercare and monitoring plans have been updated in English for 3 sites (Mau 2, Thach Luu and Hon Tro), and were subsequently translated into Vietnamese for handover to local authorities.

indicator.title: Indicator 20
indicator.description: Existence and dissemination of a communication plan on both the issues of pesticides management and contaminated sites, to allow possible population exposed to contaminated sites to adopt countermeasures to reduce exposure.

baseline.comment: No communication plan on POPs pesticides is available for public in Viet Nam

target.comment: Increase the awareness of public and local community on POPs pesticides and contaminated sites

actual.comment:
A 5-minute video clip in bi-language English-Vietnamese and 20-minute video clip in Vietnamese were produced. Copies are available at the UNDP and PMU office.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ZCFBpub9V4

indicator.title: Indicator 21
indicator.description: Three contracts of 3 major packages of the project on (1) Excavation and packaging; (2) Disposal; (3) Site rehabilitation completed

baseline.comment: No contract

target.comment: Three contracts are signed in accordance with Vietnam Procurement Law (for 2 domestic packages) and UN procurement rule (for international package)

actual.comment: This activity was completed during the previous reporting period. No further activities to report on.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: At least 7 sites with 1000 tons of highly contaminated POPs waste/stockpiles will be treated, impact on human health relieved.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
- Number of tons of POPs pesticides waste and stockpile destructed/treated
- Number of sites applied clean up & treatment measures
- Evaluation site reports, aftercare and monitoring results confirm the successful of treatment

baseline.comment: Stockpiles slowly destroyed and buried pesticides continuing forming a environmental problem by not applying International standards

target.comment: By the end of 2015, 1,140 tons of POPs pesticides will have been destroyed; mid and long term measures implemented to control and contain potential and latent risks at the sites where pesticides are removed.

actual.comment:
1. As of 30 June 2015, total POPs pesticides waste and stockpiles destroyed by the project was approximately 720 tons. Of which, around 488 tons were collected in Nghe An and Ha Tinh provinces and destroyed at Holcim during this reporting period.
2. Isolation measures/rehabilitation activities for 2 sites (Hon Tro and Thach luu) were completed in Aug 2014.
3. Field pilot for three (3) non-combustion technologies is on-going. Around 60-80 tons of POPs pesticides contaminated soil (500-3000 ppm) are being pilot-treated by non-combustion technologies using (1) Daramend technology; (2) Nano Iron soil treatment; and (3) Soil washing. The field pilots are expected to be completed by Sept-Oct 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of companies performing a test for obtaining license

baseline.comment: Only Holicm has the license to handle and destruct POPs pesticides at the begining of the project that made them as a monopoly supplier in the market in Viet Nam

target.comment: After two years from the project start, the test and assessment for obtaining license to handle and destruct POPs pesticides completed.

actual.comment:
This project activity was completed in 2012. In addition to Holcim, Thanh Cong cement in the northern part of Viet Nam also obtained a license to handle and destruct POPs pesticides at the beginning of 2013.
No further activities are anticipated because the international bidding for POPs pesticides waste treatment conducted under the project in 2013 also put a stop to the monopoly position of Holcim.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Acute risks at selected priority sites are eliminated by removing POPs pesticide waste from the site

baseline.comment:
At the beginning of the project, treatment methods to eliminate acute risks at selected priority sites was not started yet.
The priority list of contaminated sites identified more than 1,000 POPs pesticides contaminated sites in Viet Nam, 7 sites were selected for applying treatment methods from the project budget. Detail information on contamination levels of selected sites are available for determining volume of contaminated soil from 700-880 tons instead of 1,000 tons at project design. Of which, pilot 25 tons of contaminated soil in Thai Nguyen was disposed/excavated and treated at Holcim in 2011 .

target.comment: At the end of the project, objectives for the POPs pesticides waste and stockpile treatment and management completed.

actual.comment:
1. By 30 June 2015, the total POPs pesticides wastes and stockpiles destroyed by project was around 720 tons.
Of this amount, during this reporting period ~ 488 tons were collected in Nghe An and Ha Tinh provinces and destroyed at Holcim as follows:
- Around 145 tons of POPs pesticides wastes and stockpiles was collected from 3 sites in Ha Tinh (Thach Luu, Thach Huong, Son Tho) in July 2014 and was destructed at Holcim in Sept - Oct 2014
-Collection and destruction of 216 tons of POPs pesticides waste and stockpiles from the Hon Tro site were completed in September 2014.
- Collection and destruction of 59.5 tons of POPs pesticides waste and stockpiles from Chien Thang were completed in December 2014.
- Collection and destruction of 67.9 tons of POPs pesticides waste and stockpiles from the Tan Long and Tan Phu sites were completed in January 2015.
2. Isolation measures/rehabilitation activities for the for Hon Tro and Thach Luu sites were completed in August 2014.
3. Field pilots for three (3) non-combustion technologies are on-going. Around 60-80 tons of POPs pesticides contaminated soil (500-3000 ppm) are being pilot-treated by non-combustion technologies.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description:
-Number of site applying isolation measures/ rehabilitation activities.
-Environment Management Plan (EMP) completed and approved.

baseline.comment: There is no isolation measures/rehabilitation activities to reducing and containing potential and latent risks of contaminated sites.

target.comment: At the end of the project, potential and latent risks are reduced and/or contained and aftercare and monitoring program is delivered for the selected priority sites.

actual.comment:
Three (3) sites (Hon Tro, Mau 2, Thach Luu) applied isolation measures/rehabilitation activities during this reporting period.
Environmental Management Plans (EMPs) were separated into 5 phases for the sites. Previous versions of EMP were designed as an “all in one” document.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description:
-Handover documents to local authority are signed and local competent staff is trained
-Technical tools are available for POPs waste treatment and contaminated site management

baseline.comment:
-Responsibilities are not allocated
- National Target Program on Pollution Mitigation and Environment Improvement (NTP–PMEI) approved in 2012 with its 2nd component dealing with 247 high pesticides concentration sites.
- A number of technical barriers existed for smooth implementation of Decision No. 1946 and NTP-PMEI (shortage of information and data on contaminated sites, no guidance on relevant technologies to local authority, uniform template and format, etc.).
- Some provinces with high number of sites are facing difficulty in managing pesticides contaminated sites

target.comment: At the end of the project, mid and long term actions allocated for the coming 10 years and implemented

actual.comment:
1. The Thach Luu hand-over document for the local authorities (including EMP) will be signed in July 2015.
2. M&E indicators for the monitoring and reporting of the management and treatment of POPs pesticides contaminated sites were drafted in May 2015.
3. The database containing information on POPs pesticide contaminated sites is publicly available on-line at caithienmoitruong.vea.gov.vn:9000/.
The database allows data update by provinces. The data can be consolidated nation-wide and is managed at the national level. Final adjustments and corrections of the database will be completed in July 2015.
4. Handbook for the introduction of non-combustion techniques for contaminated sites targeting local authorities has been drafted.
5. As a pilot exercise the project designed a Provincial Plan for the Sustainable Management of Pesticides-contaminated sites for Nghe An province, which has hundreds of contaminated sites. The plan applies land-use purpose approaches and encourages public-private partnerships. The start of plan preparation took place in Nghe An from 22 to 23 June 2015.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Improved chemicals management prevents importation and use of POPs pesticides

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Volumes of pesticides illegally imported
Number of staff and related stakeholders trained or received necessary information

baseline.comment: At least 10 tonnes per month

target.comment: By the end of the project, the volumes of illegal pesticides confiscated are no more than 2 tonnes per month (based on equal level of effort)

actual.comment:
According to the Customs newspaper in 2014, 100 litres of illegal herbicides and 2-3 tons of wet powder were confiscated in the border provinces during the first half of 2014.
The Customs officers had already been trained in the previous reporting period.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Adoption of national chemical safety standards

baseline.comment:
The Law on Chemistry passed in 2007. The Decree 108/2008/ND-CP adopted in 2008. Circular 28/2010/TT-BCT adopted in 2010.
- Law on Environment Protection (LEP) was revised and approved in 2014 and entered into force in June 2015. Guidelines for the LEP implementation is needed.

target.comment: -Policy and legal framework for management of POPs pesticides and POPs pesticides contaminated sites improved and upgraded. 01 draft circular on guidance for classification of contaminated site completed

actual.comment: Draft study on the classification of contaminated sites was submitted as an input for drafting a circular on management of contaminated sites (to be approved in September 2015).

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of training courses completed and number of participants

baseline.comment: Almost no training in management of POPs pesticides or related issues.

target.comment: By the end of 2015 staff of all line agencies trained in management of POPs pesticides and related issues

actual.comment:
- Five (5) EMP Training courses were carried out in Quang Binh (Sep 2014), Nghe An (Oct 2014), Nam Dinh (Mar 2015), Nghe An (Mar 2015), Quang Ninh (Apr 2015). One (1) Sampling and Mapping training course was done in Nam Dinh (June 2015) for Northern provincial staff.
Two (2) more training courses on Sampling and Mapping for Central and Southern provinces are expected to take place in August 2015.
Total participants trained in this reporting period was 265. Participants come from relevant national and provincial departments.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Dissemination of compendium on legal documents

baseline.comment: No compendium of legal documents on POPs pesticides management existed

target.comment: By the end of 2011 a compendium of legal documents on POPs pesticides management has been consolidated and disseminated to all Customs offices at provinces

actual.comment: All activities were completed in 2012. No further activities to report on.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: MOU with neighbouring countries signed:

target.comment: No information

actual.comment: This activity was canceled after the mid-term review.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Number of store/facilities applying the standard criteria and design

baseline.comment: There are a number of storage that contain confiscated illegal trading pesticides and chemicals for a long time without proper risk management measures that can be leakages and become contaminated sites, such as the 20m3 storage at Lang Son provinces.

target.comment: By the end of 2015, storage facilities of at least 50 m3 with proper risk management measures built at five or more key sites

actual.comment: One (1) storage facility in Lao Cai province and one (1) storage facility in Binh Thuan provinces were repaired and upgraded by the project to meet the standard design criteria for POPs storage facilities.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Standard criteria and design for storage completed

baseline.comment: No clear standard and guideline

target.comment: Standard design for storages that contain confiscated pesticides due to illegally trading completed and introduced to provinces

actual.comment: The final revision of the Standard Design for Storage Facilities was completed in March 2015. Subsequently it will be printed and disseminated to provinces.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of policy papers and related policy documents (Op-Ed, infographic) on fossil fuel fiscal policy reform in Viet Nam 2) The extent to which awareness and understanding of government officials on renewable energy development is increased through policy dialogues and technical meetings (1-not at all; 2-little; 3-good; 4-very good) 3) The extent to which CO’s policy recommendations are incorporated in Green Growth Strategy action plan formulation and other policies promoting renewable energy development in Viet Nam (0-not at all; 1-very little; 2-significant; 3-very significant)

baseline.comment: 1) 1 policy paper on Subsidies and taxes in Vietnam’s energy sector and their effects on economic development and income distribution in the context of climate change 2) 2-little. Government officials have limited understanding of supported mechanism for renewable energy development 3) 0-not at all. CO’s policy recommendations are not yet incorporated in Green Growth Strategy action plan formulation and other policies promoting renewable energy development in Viet Nam

target.comment: 1) 1 policy paper on green growth and fossil fuel fiscal; support development of renewable energy development - Preparation for second policy paper on support development of renewable energy development 2) 3-good. Government officials have good better awareness and understanding of options forn renewable energy development through policy workshops, dialogues and technical meetings 3) 1- very little

actual.comment: 1) 1 policy paper "Green Growth and Fossil Fuel Fiscal Policies in Viet Nam – Recommendations on a Roadmap for Policy Reform". 2) 3-good. Recommendations from our policy paper on fossil fuel fiscal policy reform were incorporated in the approved Green Growth Action Plan 2014

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Gaps between Viet Nam’s Legislation on Anti-corruption and UNCAC identified. 2) Number of policy researches and dialogues providing recommendations on transparent, integrated and well-coordinated mechanisms in prevention of corruption and handling corruption cases 3) The extent to which concrete regulations on how to strengthen transparent, integrated and well-coordinated mechanisms in handling corruption cases incorporated in the new/revised laws and other legal documents (0-not at all; 1- little; 2-significantly; 3-very significantly)

baseline.comment: 1) Some gaps already identified (i) no regulations on controlling corruption/bribery in the private sector; (ii) no regulations on controlling corruption involving foreign public officials; (iii) no regulations on controlling illicit enrichment; and (iv) no regulations on controlling corruption involving legal entities. 2) There is a lack of analysis and recommendation on how to strengthen transparent, integrated and well-coordinated mechanisms in preventing and handling corruption cases 3) 0-not at all. No recommendations incorporated, as none of them were available to policy makers

target.comment: 1) Additional gaps identified in prevention, investigation and prosecution of corruption 2) 2 series of research papers and dialogues: (i) Research papers and policy dialogues on anti-corruption agency models and inputs for amendment of the Penal Code; and (ii) Research papers on public administration reforms and local governance, including: professionalization of civil servants; effectiveness of the mechanism on votes of confidence; and enhanced effectiveness and efficiency of decentralization at local levels to provide for inputs for the Law on Local Governance 3) 2-significant. Recommendations incorporated in draft Penal Code and draft Law on Local Governments

actual.comment: 1) Additional gaps identified in prevention, investigation and prosecution of corruption through research and substantive discussion at the 13th Anti-corruption Dialogue 2) - 2 Research papers and 2 high-level policy dialogues with the Central Commission on Internal Affairs (which is under the Vietnam Communist Party Central Committee, and advisory body for the Politburo in anti-corruption) on two topics: (i) Analysis of anti-corruption agency models in the world - a Vietnamese view; and (ii) improving provisions on the bribery-related crimes in the penal code of Vietnam from comparative perspective; - 1 policy discussion sharing experiences in urban governance among research institutes in five municipal cities of Viet Nam with Da Nang Institute for Socio-economic Development (DISED) 3) 2-significant. UNDP’s recommendations on how to address gaps in prevention, investigation and prosecution of corruption were incorporated into the 2nd draft of the penal code. In addition, key recommendations from the policy discussion paper on "Transparency and accountability: What role for local governments?" were incorporated into the draft Law on Local Governments

target.comment: 1) Further gaps identified in the criminal procedures for corruption crimes 2) At least one research on mechanisms to effectively control corruption crimes: international experience and lessons learnt for Viet Nam to provide inputs for the amendment of the Criminal Procedural Code 3) 2-significant. UNDP’s recommendations incorporated in draft Criminal Procedural Code and draft Law on Anti-corruption

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) One time-series tool called 'the Viet Nam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index (PAPI)' established to measure local government performance in Viet Nam. PAPI is a rigorous policy tool that monitors and measures the performance of governance and public administration of all 63 provinces in Viet Nam based on citizens’ experiences. (PAPI is part of outputs 3.3.1 and 3.3.4 of One UN Plan) 2) Number of provinces responding to PAPI findings by seeking measures to improve their performance over time 3) Number of in-depth research conducted to bring insights into why public polices do not work and how to make them work better for the benefit of citizens

baseline.comment: 1) (Baseline 2009) No available tool that provides data to track changes in local governance and public administration reforms in Viet Nam from citizens' perspectives and experiences; no available monitoring and evaluation system to measure the effectiveness and efficiency of international development partners' support for Viet Nam in the areas of governance and public administration reforms from citizens' perspective and experience 2) (Baseline 2009) No provinces have a citizen-centric measure to monitor their performance in local governance, public administration and public service delivery 3) (Baseline 2009) No evidence-based research assessing government performance in governance and public administration reforms from citizen experiences.

target.comment: 1) The Viet Nam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index (PAPI) 2013 published and disseminated to show the progress of all 63 provinces in their government performance against 2011 and 2012 nation-wide survey results (see www.papi.vn for more information about how it progresses over time since its pilot in 2009 and scale-up in 2010). 2) 10 provinces (cumulatively since 2011) responding to PAPI findings by introducing provincial directives or action plans to improve their performance by end 2014 3) 18 case studies (cumulatively since 2011) using PAPI data to look into the supply side’s inputs for dimensions under PAPI study completed by end 2014

actual.comment: 1) The Viet Nam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index (PAPI) 2013 published and disseminated at the national level, with the participation of more than 300 participants from national and provincial governments, the National Assembly, the media, the civil society organisations and the research community; the 2013 PAPI disseminated to all 63 provinces through 7 regional dissemination workshops and 8 provincial diagnostic workshops to show the progress of all 63 provinces in their government performance against 2011 baselines and over time 2) 16 provinces (cumulatively since 2011) responding to PAPI findings by introducing provincial directives or action plans to improve their performance by end 2014 (see http://papi.vn/en/provincial-policy-responses.html) 3) 18 case studies (cumulatively since 2011) using PAPI data to look into the supply side’s inputs for dimensions under PAPI study completed as of November 2014

target.comment: 1) The Viet Nam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index (PAPI) 2014 published and disseminated at the national level, involving a large diversity of stakeholders; the 2014 PAPI disseminated to provinces to show the progress of all 63 provinces in their government performance against 2011 baselines and over time in at least 7 provincial and regional workshops to disseminate PAPI 2014 convened for further policy dialogues with provinces during 2015 2) 19 provinces (cumulatively since 2011) responding to PAPI findings by introducing provincial directives or action plans to improve their performance by end 2015 3) 21 case studies (cumulatively since 2011) using PAPI data to look into the supply side’s inputs for dimensions under PAPI study completed by end 2015

actual.comment: 1) The Viet Nam Provincial Governance and Public Administration Performance Index (PAPI) 2014 published and disseminated at the national level, involving nearly 400 participants from different government and non-government sectors. 2014 PAPI findings also disseminated through: 8 regional workshops to show the progress of all 63 provinces in their government performance against 2011 baselines and over time; 3 training workshops to guide 120 elected representatives on how to use PAPI data as evidence for policy making and oversight work. Many provincial diagnostic workshops convened to have policy dialogues with provinces during 2015. 2) As of 1 Dec 2015, at least 25 provinces (cumulatively since 2011) having responded to PAPI findings by introducing provincial directives or action plans to improve their performance. 3) 21 case studies (cumulatively since 2011) using PAPI data to look into the supply side’s inputs for dimensions under PAPI study completed by end 2015.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Mechanism for monitor the progress of implementing the Strategies introduced and adopted. 2) Availability and improvement of a mechanism to improve aid coordination and multi-stakeholder participation in law and justice sector reform. 3) The extent to which planning and coordination capacity of justice institutions and personnel enhanced (Scale: 1-very little; 2-little; 3-significant; 4-very significant) 4) Drafting process to ensure gender mainstreaming in legislation introduced and adopted. 5) Number of laws drafted and endorsed following rights-based approach and ensure greater coherence with international human rights standards. 6) Established mechanism to support National Steering Committee on Judicial Reform's decision-making process on a number of cross-cutting policy issues.

baseline.comment: 1) Mechanism for monitoring the overall progress of implementing strategies does not exist due to the lack of coordination by individual justice institutions. 2) Mechanism for aid coordination in law and justice sector reform does not exist. Weakness in aid coordination in legal and judicial sectors resulted in overlap and low level of synergy. 3) 1-very little. Limited capacity of the justice institutions in sector wide planning and coordination, in particular in the areas of statistical system, monitoring and reporting. 4) Standardized requirements and process to ensure gender mainstreaming in legislation does not exist. 5) 0. Laws being drafted without assessment of the potential impacts to rights holders to ensure the realization of Vietnam commitments to international human rights bodies. 6) Mechanism not available to support the National Steering Committee for Judicial Reform on judicial reform decision making.

target.comment: 1) Mechanism for monitor the progress of implementing the Legal System Development and Implementation Strategy adopted. 2) A new platform for knowledge sharing and update on aid coordination in law and judicial sector created, in complementary to the existing policy forums and dialogues. 3) 2-little. Increased capacity of the justice sector personnel in law development and implementation. 4) Use of the gender mainstreaming drafting tool in the drafting of the Law on Civil Status; Identified measures to improve women's access to judicial services. 5) 2 laws. Supported legislative changes toward building a stronger law-based society with pro-poor policies, increased access to justice and protection of citizens’ rights with focus to the Penal Code amendment and the Law on Civil Status. 6) Strengthened mechanism to support the judicial reform decision making through cross-cutting research and policy advisory service to strengthen the central role of the court in improving access to justice and protection of citizens’ rights.

actual.comment: 1) The mechanism for 8-year review of the Legal System Development and Implementation Strategy adopted with the participation of independent experts. 2) Launched a shared portal for knowledge sharing and informing on the justice sector's international cooperation, information and documentation on law and judiciary reform available for public use. 3) 3-significant. Improved capacity of the MOJ staff to improve its performance and ranking as reviewed by the Ministerial Effectiveness Index of Business Law Development and Implementation (MEI). 4) Completion of the assessment on women's access to judicial services in Viet Nam and recommended solutions to address gender inequality and to facilitate women’s access to judicial services. 5) 2 laws. Completed a comprehensive review of the Penal Procedure Code through the lens of international human rights law and standards, concrete recommendations to improve the law in forthcoming amendments sent to Supreme Procuracy, National Assembly and Central Committee for Internal Affairs; Supported advocacy for equal rights of LGBT people, the rights of women and children in the making of the Law on Civil Status, see UN joint recommendations to the draft Law on Civil Status. 6) Through the established mechanism to support judicial reform decision making, policy advisory provided to address main challenges in reforming the court system, including the effectiveness of the court-annexed conciliation, and the court restructure at different jurisdictions.

target.comment: 1) Built on the 2014 result, the mechanism of 8-year review of the Legal System Development and Implementation Strategy resulted in a comprehensive assessment with policy recommendations to be submitted to the Central Committee for Internal Affairs (CCIA). 2) Support to implementation of the new Decree on aid coordination and international cooperation in law, judicial reform. 3) No target for 2015. 4) No target for 2015. 5) 3 laws. Ensure rights-based and due process in law reform, with focus on the amendments of the Penal Code and the Civil Code, and the implementation of the Constitution amendments. 6) Continue to support the judicial reform decision making through cross-cutting research and policy advisory service to strengthen the central role of the court in improving access to justice and protection of citizens’ rights.

actual.comment: 1) A comprehensive review of the implementation of the Legal System Development Strategy conducted, and directions to continue strengthening the legal framework and institution endorsed for the period 2016-2020. 2) Concrete actions to implement the Decree taken; a coordination group established led by the Ministry of Justice, and the Annual Legal Partnership Forum organized. 3) Not applicable, as no target for this indicator for 2015. 4) Not applicable, as no target for this indicator for 2015 5) 3 laws, of which the revised Penal Code approved with changes provided with UNDP technical assistance in (i) reduction of number of crimes subject to capital punishment; (ii) introduction of criminal responsibility to legal entities committed environmental crimes. 6) Completed research on summary civil procedures, and its recommendations were considered for reflection in the revised Law on Civil Procedures approved in November.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1) Availability of a comprehensive financing mechanism to provide finance for national protected areas systems and biodiversity conservation

2) 0. There is no wetland protected area system yet. Regulations/procedures for establishment of a wetland protected area not in place

1) The inter-minsterial circular on biodiversity financing developed

actual.comment:
1) A joint circular developed and approved by Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and Ministry of Finance. One publication on institution and one on finance for biodiversity issued
2) Four decisions/proposals made: (i) Decision of the People’s Committee of Hai Phong and Lam Dong provinces on increasing ticket price of Cat Ba and Bi Doup National parks; (ii) Scheme on increasing and sharing revenues from renting environment services at Cat Ba (Hai Phong City) and Xuan Thuy (Nam Dinh province) national parks developed (pending for approval of the Hai Phong and Nam Dinh People’s Committee of Provinces)

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: A comprehensive and harmonized legal and policy framework supports sustainable PA financing

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Legal, regulatory and institutional frameworks component of the UNDP Financial Scorecard

target.comment: At the end of the project the score for has increased to at least 50

actual.comment: Will be updated at Project completion (end 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Capacity to conceptualize and formulate policies, legislations, strategies and programmes component of the UNDP Capacity Scorecard

target.comment: At the end of the project the score has increased to at least 7.5

actual.comment: Will be updated at Project completion (end of 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Approval of regulations

baseline.comment: No regulations approved

target.comment: By the end of year 4 of project implementation regulations have been formally issued (these regulations incorporate specific measures related to populations living within PAs)

actual.comment:
Almost achieved.
The project has supported the development of the following regulations/legal documents:
1. Decision No 24 of Prime Minister on investment on special use forest, coming into effect on 20 July, 2012. The decision states that the government supports 40,000,000 vnd (2,000 USD) per hamlet in buffer zones per year to co-manage forest. Ministry of Planning and Investment led the development of this decision and the project supported by providing inputs and undertaking consultation to develop the Decision.
2. Inter-ministerial circular No. 160/TTLT-BTC-BTNMT between Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and Ministry of Finance on 19 Oct 2014 on biodiversity financing states that State budget can be allocated to develop biodiversity sustainable/wise use models in PAs. It creates an opportunity for local people to work with management boards and to receive budget from government to set up these kind of models.
3. Decision No. 119/QD-UBND on 23 Jan 2015 of Nam Dinh Provincial People Committee on sustainable mollusk harvesting. According to the Decision, local people have to pay a user fee to Xuan Thuy management board to engage in mollusk raising and management board has responsibility to guide them in techniques on sustainable mollusk raising. The amount as agreed by the local community, Xuan Thuy national park and the District People Committee is 2.000.000 vnd(98 USD)/ha/year.
4. Decision No. 2393/QD-UBND on 06 Nov 2014 of Lam Dong Provincial People Committee allows pilot Payments for Forest Ecosystem Services. Hydropower companies are required to pay the BD-NB management board an amount (around 150,000 USD) for forest protection per year. Part of this amount will be used to train local people in forest protection and afforestation.
5. Draft Decision of Hai Phong PPC allows pilot concessions in Cat Ba national park. This draft Decision was developed and circulated to related provincial departments for official comment. The final draft has been submitted to Hai Phong PPC for approval.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: National PES policy identifies PES as one of the financing mechanisms for PAs

baseline.comment: Draft policy under development

target.comment: The text of the PM's Decision on PES incorporates unambiguous wording establishing the basis for PAs to receive a significant proportion of PES funding for ecosystem services originating from land within the PA

actual.comment:
Achieved
1. Decree No 99 of Government on Payment for Forest Ecosystem Services (PFES) policy identifies PFES as a financing mechanism for PAs.
2. Decision No 24 of Prime Minister on investment on special use forest encourages PES in PAs, especially ecotourism
3. Circular No. 20/2012/TT-BNNPTNT by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development (7 May 2012) stipulates the provision of guidelines for procedures on confirmation and acceptance of monies payable for forestry ecosystem services
4. Inter-ministerial circular No. 160/TTLT-BTC-BTNMT on 29 Oct 2014 between MONRE and MOF allows using state budget to value ecosystem services and to enhance PES implementation.
The project has support to implement PES in demonstration sites as following: 1. In Xuan Thuy national park, the project has supported the park to develop a proposal on mollusk raising user fee collection and benefit sharing among stakeholders. 2. In Cat Ba national park, the project has supported the park to develop the proposal on increasing entrance fee and price for concession (hiring land to provide tourism services) 3. In Bidoup - Nui Ba national park, the project has supported the park to develop the proposal on increasing revenue from Payment for Forest Ecosystem Services

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Guidelines for operationalization of PM's Decision on PA financing

baseline.comment: No guidelines prepared

target.comment: Guidelines on implementation of the PM's Decision on Sustainable Financing issued during the first year of project implementation reflect international best practice

actual.comment:
Achieved.
Inter-ministerial circular No. 100 between MOF and MARD, which guides the implementation of Decision No. 24 on investment on special use forests was approved on 26 Jul, 2013

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Existence of off-site financing policy and strategy

baseline.comment: New strategy under development

target.comment: By the end of year 1 of project implementation a new Tourism Development Strategy incorporates off-site financing

actual.comment: This indicator is unlikely to be achieved. The 'Vietnam Tourism Development Strategy to 2020 Vision to 2030' was approved in late 2011, just as project implementation was underway. The project had no opportunity to integrate off-site financing into the Strategy. No further progress has been made during this reporting period.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Clear and harmonized institutional mandates and processes support sustainable PA financing mechanisms

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Score for the "Business planning and tools for cost-effective management" component of the UNDP Financial Scorecard

target.comment: At the end of the project the score has increased to at least 45

actual.comment: Will be updated at Project completion (end 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Score for the "Capacity to implement policies, legislation, strategies and programmes" component of the UNDP Capacity Scorecard

target.comment: At the end of the project the score has increased to at least 32

actual.comment: Will be updated at Project completion (end 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Establishment of a mechanism to promote coordination between MONRE and MARD

baseline.comment: No mechanism exists

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, a coordinating mechanism has been created by decree/decision

actual.comment: After discussion among UNDP, MONRE and MARD, it has been decided that the mechanism to promote coordination between MONRE and MARD is best agreed at the relevant agency level, in this case - Vietnam Environment Administration under MONRE and Vietnam Forest Administration under MARD. These two agencies are the administrations directly responsible for biodiversity conservation and protected area management within their respective Ministries. At 30 June, VEA, MONRE and VNFOREST, MARD were in the final stages of negotiating a Memorandum of Understanding.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Mechanism is operational

baseline.comment: As above

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of the project the coordinating mechanism is promoting a coordinated approach to PA management (see also Output 4.1).

actual.comment: As mentioned above, the draft mechanism is expected to be approved by Aug, 2015. Implementation will follow after approval.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Proportion of PA managers and staff trained in essential skills

baseline.comment: No PA managers trained in issues such as business planning

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of project implementation, PA staff from at least 50% of PAs have been trained in key skills, such as business planning; by the end of the project this figure is 85%

actual.comment:
Achieved.
From Jun 2014 to Jun 2015: MONRE organized 12 training courses and MARD organized 13 training courses.
Total PAs participated in all 25 training courses are 97 PAs, representing 90.6% of all PAs (of the 107 PAs with established management boards). Of these, 83 PAs sent PA Directors/Vice Directors to attend the training, representing 77.5% of attendees.
In MTR report, it was proposed that the this indicator should be changed to "By the end of year 3 of project implementation, PA staff from at least 50% of PAs have been trained in key skills, such as business planning; by the end of the project this figure is 85%". The project has achieved this target.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Proportion of PA rangers trained in essential skills

baseline.comment: Pilot programme for ranger training (CBBC)

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of project implementation, rangers and other staff from at least 60% of PAs have been trained in key skills; by the end of the project this figure is 85%

actual.comment: Achieved. Please see response above.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Existence of system-wide system of incentives

baseline.comment: Current incentive system ineffective and disjointed

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, a revised system of incentives designed to promote improve performance among PA staff has been drafted and endorsed by PA managers

actual.comment:
Research undertaken by MARD found that the current salary of PA staff is not high enough to attract high preforming people. Therefore, a draft inter-ministerial between MARD and Ministry of Internal Affairs has been developed to issue professional standards for conservation staff to attract professional personnel committed to conservation work.
Based on MTR recommendations and actions under the Management Response, a review of existing criteria and proposal for biodiversity-based criteria in performance indicators has been developed.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Evidence of incentive system in operation

baseline.comment: As above

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of project implementation the revised system is in operation

actual.comment: Please see above

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Level of support for revised incentive system

baseline.comment: Little awareness of benefits of effective system

target.comment: By the end of the project, at least 60% of PA managers indicate that the revised incentives have improved PA management

actual.comment: Please see above

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Knowledge and experience of sustainable financing options developed through demonstrations

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Score for the "Tools for Revenue Generation" component of the UNDP Financial Scorecard

baseline.comment: score of 13

target.comment: At the end of the project the score has increased to at least 35

actual.comment: Will be updated on Project completion (end 2015)

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Existence of measures to increase tourism revenues

baseline.comment: Tourism revenue generation low

target.comment: By the end of year 1 of project implementation measures to increase tourism revenue (in parallel with improved tourism services) have been identified at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment:
Achieved.
The PPC governing the Cat Ba National Park approved the 2 USD entrance fee to be levied for both national and international tourists. The Decision (No. 1780) to enable this entry fee came into effect in September 2014.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Existence of measures to generate revenues from concessions

baseline.comment: Concession revenue generation low

target.comment: By the end of year 1 of project implementation measures to increase revenue from commercial concession have been identified at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment: As per last year, the proposal on concession has been submitted to PPC and is pending approval.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Measures to generate PES

baseline.comment: Pilot revenue generation yet to be tested

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, measures are in place to generate revenues from PES at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment:
Achieved.
Lam Dong Provincial People Committee issued decision No. 2393/QD-UBND on 06 Nov 2014 allowing for pilot Payments for Forest Ecosystem Services. A Hydropower company is now required to pay Bidoup-Nui Ba National Park Management Board approximately USD 150,000 for forest protection each year.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Measures to generate revenues from sustainable harvesting

baseline.comment: No revenue generation

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, measures are in place to generate revenues from sustainable harvesting of natural resources at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment:
Achieved.
Nam Dinh Provincial People Committee issued decision No. 119/QD-UBND on 23 Jan 2015 on sustainable mollusk harvesting. According to the Decision, local people must pay user fees to the Xuan Thuy management board for permits to farm mollusks and the management board is responsible for guiding them in sustainable mollusk raising techniques. The amount agreed by local community, Xuan Thuy national park and District People Committee is 2.000.000 vnd(98 USD)/ha/year.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Capture of lessons to improve the legal environment

baseline.comment: Sustainable financing guidelines have no lessons on which they are based

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of project implementation, lessons from increasing revenues have contributed to revised guidelines under Output 1.2

actual.comment: Ongoing. To date the project has not consolidated the information on lessons learned to improve the legal environment.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Analysis of opportunities for cost efficiencies

baseline.comment: No analyses undertaken

target.comment: By the end of year 1 of project implementation, opportunities for increased cost efficiencies by cross-PA cooperation and coordination have been identified at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment: Achieved. See previous year

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Measures to promote cost efficiencies

baseline.comment: No measures in place

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, measures are in place to increase cost efficiencies by cross-PA cooperation and coordination at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment: Achieved. See previous year.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Capture of lessons to improve the legal environment

baseline.comment: Sustainable financing guidelines have no lessons on which they are based

target.comment: By the end of year 3 of project implementation, lessons from increasing cost efficiencies by cross-PA cooperation and coordination have contributed to revised guidelines under Output 1.3 and the decree/decision to create a PA authority under Output 1.5

actual.comment: A report analyzing cost - efficiencies on cooperation between Cat Ba and Bai Tu Long has been developed.

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: Existence of a pilot provincial BD plan

baseline.comment: No such plans exist

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation, a provincial BD plan has been developed at one or more pilot sites

actual.comment:
Achieved.
Cao Bang PPC has an approved Provincial Biodiversity Conservation Plan to 2020 by Decision No. 867/STNMT-BVMT on 27 May 2015

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Application of system-wide monitoring

baseline.comment: No system-wide application

target.comment: By the end of year 4 of project implementation the system-wide monitoring programme is operational

actual.comment: A draft circular on biodiversity monitoring and reporting among related ministries, provincial departments on natural resources and environment and PAs is in the process of consultation and appraisal before official submission to MONRE for approval.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Linking of budgets to needs defined from monitoring

baseline.comment: Budgets not linked to needs

target.comment: By the end of the project PA budgeting is linked to monitoring results

actual.comment: When above mentioned draft circular is approved by MONRE, biodiversity monitoring will be implemented and results linked to budgets.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Existence of system-wide reporting approach

baseline.comment: No system in place

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation a reporting process has been designed and endorsed by key stakeholders, including PA managers

actual.comment: Achieved. See previous year.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: CHM operational

baseline.comment: No CHM design

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation the Clearing House is operational

actual.comment: The CHM has been designed, but is not yet operational. The Biodiversity Database has been developed to allow PAs to share their information/data/reports on biodiversity and will be formally launched later this year.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: PA-specific BD reports

baseline.comment: No reports produced

target.comment: By the end of year 4 of project implementation reports are produced for at least 30% of all PAs; by the end of the project this figure is at least 60%

actual.comment: The indicator target of 60% of all PAs completing such reports will not be met as no additional sites are expected to produce reports before the project ends. However, it is important to note that this indicator was not realistic as the project design never proposed site level activities at sites apart from the three demonstration sites (in addition, PA units in Vietnam were unable to allocate funds for BD reporting until the passage in 2014 of Inter-ministerial circular No. 16 between MONRE and MOF on biodiversity financing). In the reporting period, the project has supported Xuan Thuy and Cat Ba national parks to produce comprehensive biodiversity reports in line with reporting requirements.

indicator.title: Indicator 8
indicator.description: Existence of public awareness campaign design

baseline.comment: No campaign designed

target.comment: By the end of year 1 of project implementation a public awareness campaign has been designed and approved by MONRE

actual.comment:
Achieved.
The project has completed the design of a program on awareness raising and has begun implementation.

indicator.title: Indicator 9
indicator.description: Public awareness campaign implemented

baseline.comment: As above

target.comment: By the end of year 2 of project implementation the public awareness campaign is operational

actual.comment:
The program on public awareness has begun implementation.
In addition, this year the project supported the celebrations for International Day on Biodiversity (22 May 2015). Many events were organized as part of the BD Day celebrations, including an exhibition on Vietnam heritage trees and a forum on building partnership to conserve biodiversity, chaired by BCA (MONRE), DoNC (MARD) and a NGO. A special biodiversity issue of the 'Viet Nam Environment Administration Magazine' was sent to 63 DONREs, over 100 PAs. This issue includes both an article written by the Project Management Unit on the PA project's achievements and an article written by the UNDP Viet Nam on the importance of governance and financing on biodiversity conservation in Viet Nam.

indicator.title: Indicator 10
indicator.description: Increase in public awareness

baseline.comment: Basic awareness

target.comment: By the end of the project, measures of public awareness and support for PAs have increased by at least 30% of their baseline values

actual.comment: A questionnaire to assess awareness has been developed and will be distributed to the demonstration sites shortly.
