indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of strategic leaders trained with the revised gender-sensitive curriculum at the Ho Chi Minh Political Academy (HCMA). 2) Number of female officials participated in Women’s Leadership Program that was developed and institutionalized in HCMA. 3) Representation of women in Party Committees, National Assembly and People’s Councils 4) Number of female officers in the public sector having access to training courses on soft skills and participate in a mentoring programme. 5) Availability of the human resource procedures that promote women’s participation in leadership positions 6) Number of female officers who have access to the research grant program 7) Number of draft laws that have gender analysis conducted and fed to national law drafting team and National Assembly members 8) The extent to which university curriculum is gender sensitive (Scale: 0-not at all; 1-very litte; 2-little; 3-significant; 4-very significant)

baseline.comment: 1) 0. Existing training programs at the HCMA, its sub academies, and 63 provincial political schools are gender blind. 2) 0. Women in the public sector have limited access to professional leadership training programs run by government institutions. Few women civil servants receive training in leadership or management skills 3) For the 2011-2016 term, the percentage of women is 9% for the Central Committee of the Communist Party, 24.4% for the National Assembly, and less than 28% for the People’s Councils at all levels. 4) Women in the public sector have limited access to professional leadership training programs run by government institutions. 5) No availability. The current hiring, promotion and selection for training process in the civil service have not met the targets of the Strategy on Gender Equality. 6) 43 female officers were awarded research grants since 2009. However, the quality of their research and their understanding of gender mainstreaming still varies. 7) 0 law 8) 0-not at all. Most of university curriculum used in Viet Nam are gender blind.

target.comment: 1) At least 200 strategic leaders trained with the revised gender-sensitive curriculum at the Ho Chi Minh Political Academy 2) 0, but the Women's Leadership Program developed and piloted at HCMA 3) No specific target, as the elections will not take place until 2016. Interim target are: Potential candidates better prepared for 2016 elections through the development and dissemination of Manual for Mentoring Programme Coordinators and a joint action plan between Fatherland Front and Women's Union to increase women's representation on election ballots and to meet targets of National Strategy for Gender Equality. 4) At least 1500 officers have access to training courses on soft skills. 5) The guidelines for human resource officials and senior managers in the development and implementation of human resource strategies developed and disseminated 6) 15 female officers have access to the research grant program 7) Two draft laws that have gender analysis conducted and fed to national law drafting team and National Assembly members 8) No target for 2014

actual.comment: 1) UNDP worked with Ho Chi Minh National Academy of Politics to mainstream gender The curriculum of Strategic Leadership Training Course. We also developed a 2-day gender module and incorporated it into the course curriculum. 288 strategic leaders (many of them are at the vice minister-level up) have been trained with this revised gender-sensitive curriculum. 2) The Women's Leadership Program was developed. One pilot training conducted for 30 female government officers. 3) No specific result yet, as the elections will not take place until 2016. Key interim results are: The Manual for Mentoring Programme Coordinators developed, providing a new and effective capacity building approach for women leaders. 920 staff of about 10 agencies got access to this Manual. HCMA and Women’s Union supported to pilot a mentoring programme in their organizations. An action plan developed jointly by Fatherland Front and Women's Union that set out necessary actions to increase women's representation on election ballots. 4) 1,720 female officers in the public sector participated in UNDP-supported training on leadership skills 5) The guidelines for human resource officials and senior managers in the development and implementation of human resource strategies developed and disseminated. Training to personnel officers and action plan developed at provincial level on gender sensitive human resource practices 6) 15 female officers have access to the research grant program 7) 2 draft laws. Civil society organizations supported to do gender analysis of the draft Law on Organization of National Assembly and the Election Law, to conduct wider consultation on recommendations for amendments and to feed these recommendations to the law drafting team and National Assembly members 8) No result, as no target was set for 2014

target.comment: 1) 100 strategic leaders trained with this revised gender-sensitive curriculum. 2) The Women's Leadership Program finalized and 40 trainers benefited from the TOT training. 3) No specific target, as the elections will not take place until 2016. Interim targets are: At least 800 potential candidates for National Assembly and People's Council trained on leadership skills; At least 80 trainers trained; The Leadership Training Manual developed and disseminated to 63 provinces and widely used; An e-learning course developed and posted on internet for free access of potential candidates. 4) At least 250 female officers in the public sector participated in UNDP-supported training on leadership skills. 5) At least 120 people being trained on mainstreaming gender into HR practices. 6) No target for 2015 7) At least 1 draft law (Law on Organisation of Government) that has gender analysis conducted and fed to national law drafting team and National Assembly members 8) 2-little, through training for lecturers on gender mainstreaming in curriculum.

actual.comment: 1) 100 strategic leaders being trained about gender equality, international experiences in gender equality with (this revised gender-sensitive curriculum) 2.)The Women's Leadership Program finalized and 40 trainers benefited from the TOT training 3) No specific result, as the elections will not take place until 2016. Key interim results are: 980 potential candidates for National Assembly and People's Council trained to have a systematic knowledge and leadership skills which are necessary for the election; At least 80 trainers trained and then provided training for potential candidates on leadership skills; The Leadership Training Manual developed and disseminated to 63 provinces and widely used by potential candidates; An e-learning course developed and posted on internet for free access of potential candidates. 4) 250 female officers in the public sector participated in UNDP-supported training on leadership skills. 5) 120 people trained on mainstreaming gender into HR practices. correct 6) N/A, as no target was set for 2015. 7) 2 draft law (Law on Organisation of Government and Law on Election) that has gender analysis conducted and fed to national law drafting team and National Assembly members 8) 2-little. 50 university lecturers trained on gender mainstreaming in the training curriculum.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1) Number of body to provide scientific advice to the government/ decision makers. 2) Number of new law on Meteorology and Hydrology. 3) Number of Vietnam's official document to make commitment and fulfill its obligations under UN Framework on Climate Change. 4) Number of plans or documents for the implementation of Viet Nam commitment. 5) Number of master Plans for Flood Management for Deltas in Viet Nam. 6) The extent to which Vietnam's negotiation capacity in international climate change area improved (Scale: 1-very little; 2-relatively good; 3-good; 4-very good). 7) Number of regular update of climate change Scenario for Viet Nam. 8) Number of research report and policy analysis on climate change

baseline.comment: 1) 0. Vietnam Panel on Climate Change (VPCC) to provide scientific advice to the National Committee on Climate Change, chaired by the Prime Minister, is not in place. 2) 0. There was no law on Meteorology and Hydrology. 3) 0. Vietnam and all countries are requested to prepare Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) with concrete greenhouse gas emission reduction targets and climate change adaptation measures, for submission to the UN Framework on Climate Change. 4) 0. There was no roadmap of the INDC. 5) 1. There was an old Master Plan on Flood Management for Mekong Delta approved in 2009. 6) 1-very little. Vietnam's participation and contribution to international climate change negotiation was at minimal, mainly passive participation. 7) 2. There were climate change Scenario published in 2009 and 2011 (sea level rise, changes of weather conditions, etc.) for socio-economic and investment planning, , with technical support from UNDP. 8) 1. There was a Global Special Report on Climate Extremes (SREX), not no such report for Viet Nam has been ever in placed.

target.comment: 1) 0, but draft proposal for establishment of Vietnam Panel on Climate Change (VPCC) developed. 2) 0, but policy studies report providing inputs for the preparation of a new law on Meteorology and Hydrology produced 3) 0, but a concept note for a Viet Nam's Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) developed 4) No target for 2014. This is for 2016 5) No target for 2014. This is for 2016 6) No target for 2014. This is for 2015 7) No target for 2014. This is for 2015 8) 1. Draft of Vietnam's Special Report on Climate Extremes (SREX).

actual.comment: 1) 0, but draft proposal for establishment of Vietnam Panel on Climate Change (VPCC) developed. 2) 0, but 2 policy studies report providing inputs for the preparation of a new law on Meteorology and Hydrology produced. 3) 0, but a concept note for a Viet Nam's Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) developed. 4) NA, as no target was set for 2014 5) NA, as no target was set for 2014 6) NA, as no target was set for 2014 7) NA, as no target was set for 2014 8) 1. Various drafts of Vietnam's Special Report on Climate Extremes (SREX) prepared.

target.comment: 1) 1 body. Vietnam Panel on Climate Change (VPCC) established and operated to provide scientific advice to the National Committee on Climate Change which is chaired by the Prime Minister. 2) 1. A new law on Meteorology and Hydrology with integration of climate change, and early warning and forecasting system, and communication mechanisms. 3) 1. Vietnam's Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) with concrete greenhouse gas emission reduction targets and climate change adaptation measures, approved and submitted to the UN Framework on Climate Change. 4) No target for 2015. This is for 2016 5) No target for 2015. This is for 2016 6) 2-relatively good. Vietnam's active participation and contribution to international climate change negotiation improved. 7) 1. Draft updated climate change Scenario which provide scientific foundation (sea level rise, changes of weather conditions, etc.) for socio-economic and investment planning and development approved for application. 8) 1. Draft of Vietnam's Special Report on Climate Extremes (SREX) prepared to provide scientific information to public and decision makers

actual.comment: 1) 1 body. Vietnam Panel on Climate Change (VPCC) established and operational to provide scientific advice to the National Committee on Climate Change which is chaired by the Prime Minister. 2) A new law on Meteorology and Hydrology with integration of climate change, and early warning and forecasting system, and communication mechanisms, approved by National Assembly. 3) 1. Vietnam's Intended Nationally Determined Contributions (INDCs) with concrete greenhouse gas emission reduction targets and climate change adaptation measures, approved by the Prime Minister and submitted to the UN Framework on Climate Change. 4) NA, as no target was set for 2015 5) NA, as no target was set for 2015 6) 2-relatively good. Vietnam's active participation and contribution to international climate change negotiation and organization of its own first ever Pavilion with 12 technical side events. 7) 1. Draft updated climate change Scenario prepared and will be finalized in 2016. 8) 1. Draft of Vietnam's Special Report on Climate Extremes (SREX) prepared and will be launched in early 2016.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. M& E mechanism for Viet Nam Green Growth Strategy and Action Plan 2. Guideline on green growth investment. 3. Guideline for preparation of sectoral and provincial green growth action plan. 4. Number of sectoral and provincial GG action plans with GHG emission targets. 5. Communication action plan, and number of events and media coverage. 6. Number of policy studies and dialogues relating to green investments, green transportation, green procurement and financial tools for green development. 7. Level of availability of financial data and information to interested stakeholders. 8. Number of report on climate public and private expenditures. 9. Number of green growth projects ideas and proposals.

baseline.comment: 1. M& E mechanism is not in place. 2. No guideline is in place. 3. No guideline is in place. 4. No GG action plan has been formulated for target sectors and provinces. 5. Communication action plan is not in place. 6. Limited studies have been produced by other development partners. 7. A UNDP-WB supported website in place and some scattered information in various websites. 8. No report on climate finance expenditures produced; 9. No green growth projects ideas and proposals by businesses in place

target.comment: not applicable as the project started early 2015

actual.comment: not applicable as the project started early 2015

target.comment: 1. The M& E mechanism for Viet Nam Green Growth Strategy drafted 2. Not a target for 2015, for it is for 2016. 3. Guidelines for preparation of sectoral and provincial green growth action plans approved. 4. Two provincial Green Growth action plans with GHG emission reduction targets formulated. 5. Not a target for 2015, it is for 2016. 6. Five report of studies on green transportation and financial tools for green development, prepared. 7. Not a target for 2015, it is for 2016 and 2017 8. One report on national climate public expenditure and investment review completed and launched. 9. Not a target for 2015; it is for 2016, 2017, and 2018

actual.comment: 1. The M& E mechanism for Viet Nam Green Growth Strategy prepared and will be finalized in early 2016. 2. NA, as no target was set for 2015 3. A national guidelines for preparation of sectoral and provincial green growth action plans prepared and awaiting for approval by MPI. 4. Quang Ninh Green Growth Action Plan approved in Nov 2015 and Green Growth Action Plan of Da Lat city finalized and pending for a formal approval. 5. NA, as no target was set for 2015 6. Five reports prepared and will be finalized in early 2016.. 7. NA, as no target was set for 2015 8. Report on national climate public expenditure and investment review completed and launched in May 2015. 9. NA, as no target was set for 2015
